trans-unit.source: Use Hadoop Oozie in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Hadoop Oozie in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Use Hadoop Oozie in HDInsight, a big data service. Learn how to define an Oozie workflow, and submit an Oozie job.
trans-unit.target: Use Hadoop Oozie in HDInsight, a big data service. Learn how to define an Oozie workflow, and submit an Oozie job.

trans-unit.source: Use Oozie with Hadoop to define and run a workflow in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Use Oozie with Hadoop to define and run a workflow in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Apache Oozie to define a workflow and run the workflow on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Apache Oozie to define a workflow and run the workflow on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: To learn about the Oozie coordinator, see <link><linkText>Use time-based Hadoop Oozie Coordinator with HDInsight[hdinsight-oozie-coordinator-time]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To learn about the Oozie coordinator, see <link><linkText>Use time-based Hadoop Oozie Coordinator with HDInsight[hdinsight-oozie-coordinator-time]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To learn Azure Data Factory, see <link><linkText>Use Pig and Hive with Data Factory[azure-data-factory-pig-hive]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To learn Azure Data Factory, see <link><linkText>Use Pig and Hive with Data Factory[azure-data-factory-pig-hive]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: What is Oozie?
trans-unit.target: What is Oozie?

trans-unit.source: Apache Oozie is a workflow/coordination system that manages Hadoop jobs.
trans-unit.target: Apache Oozie is a workflow/coordination system that manages Hadoop jobs.

trans-unit.source: It is integrated with the Hadoop stack, and it supports Hadoop jobs for Apache MapReduce, Apache Pig, Apache Hive, and Apache Sqoop.
trans-unit.target: It is integrated with the Hadoop stack, and it supports Hadoop jobs for Apache MapReduce, Apache Pig, Apache Hive, and Apache Sqoop.

trans-unit.source: It can also be used to schedule jobs that are specific to a system, like Java programs or shell scripts.
trans-unit.target: It can also be used to schedule jobs that are specific to a system, like Java programs or shell scripts.

trans-unit.source: The workflow you will implement by following the instructions in this tutorial contains two actions:
trans-unit.target: The workflow you will implement by following the instructions in this tutorial contains two actions:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Workflow diagram</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Workflow diagram</linkText>

trans-unit.source: A Hive action runs a HiveQL script to count the occurrences of each log-level type in a log4j file.
trans-unit.target: A Hive action runs a HiveQL script to count the occurrences of each log-level type in a log4j file.

trans-unit.source: Each log4j file consists of a line of fields that contains a [LOG LEVEL] field that shows the type and the severity, for example:
trans-unit.target: Each log4j file consists of a line of fields that contains a [LOG LEVEL] field that shows the type and the severity, for example:

trans-unit.source: The Hive script output is similar to:
trans-unit.target: The Hive script output is similar to:

trans-unit.source: For more information about Hive, see <link><linkText>Use Hive with HDInsight[hdinsight-use-hive]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Hive, see <link><linkText>Use Hive with HDInsight[hdinsight-use-hive]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: A Sqoop action exports the HiveQL output to a table in an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: A Sqoop action exports the HiveQL output to a table in an Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Sqoop, see <link><linkText>Use Hadoop Sqoop with HDInsight[hdinsight-use-sqoop]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Sqoop, see <link><linkText>Use Hadoop Sqoop with HDInsight[hdinsight-use-sqoop]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For supported Oozie versions on HDInsight clusters, see <link><linkText>What's new in the Hadoop cluster versions provided by HDInsight?[hdinsight-versions]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For supported Oozie versions on HDInsight clusters, see <link><linkText>What's new in the Hadoop cluster versions provided by HDInsight?[hdinsight-versions]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial works on HDInsight versions 3.0 and 2.1.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial works on HDInsight versions 3.0 and 2.1.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial has not been tested on HDInsight emulator.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial has not been tested on HDInsight emulator.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To execute Windows PowerShell scripts, you must run as an administrator and set the execution policy to RemoteSigned.
trans-unit.target: To execute Windows PowerShell scripts, you must run as an administrator and set the execution policy to RemoteSigned.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Run Windows PowerShell scripts[powershell-script]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Run Windows PowerShell scripts[powershell-script]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: An HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: An HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For information about creating an HDInsight cluster, see <link><linkText>Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using custom options[hdinsight-provision]</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Get started using Hadoop with Hive in HDInsight to analyze mobile handset use[hdinsight-get-started]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about creating an HDInsight cluster, see <link><linkText>Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using custom options[hdinsight-provision]</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Get started using Hadoop with Hive in HDInsight to analyze mobile handset use[hdinsight-get-started]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Filling in the values in the tables will be helpful for going through this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Filling in the values in the tables will be helpful for going through this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Define Oozie workflow and the related HiveQL script
trans-unit.target: Define Oozie workflow and the related HiveQL script

trans-unit.source: Oozie workflows definitions are written in hPDL (a XML Process Definition Language).
trans-unit.target: Oozie workflows definitions are written in hPDL (a XML Process Definition Language).

trans-unit.source: The default workflow file name is workflow.xml.
trans-unit.target: The default workflow file name is workflow.xml.

trans-unit.source: You will save the workflow file locally, and then deploy it to the HDInsight cluster by using Windows PowerShell later in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will save the workflow file locally, and then deploy it to the HDInsight cluster by using Windows PowerShell later in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: The Hive action in the workflow calls a HiveQL script file.
trans-unit.target: The Hive action in the workflow calls a HiveQL script file.

trans-unit.source: This script file contains three HiveQL statements:
trans-unit.target: This script file contains three HiveQL statements:

trans-unit.source: The DROP TABLE statement deletes the log4j Hive table if it exists.
trans-unit.target: The DROP TABLE statement deletes the log4j Hive table if it exists.

trans-unit.source: The CREATE TABLE statement creates a log4j Hive external table that points to the location of the log4j log file.
trans-unit.target: The CREATE TABLE statement creates a log4j Hive external table that points to the location of the log4j log file.

trans-unit.source: The field delimiter is ",".
trans-unit.target: The field delimiter is ",".

trans-unit.source: The default line delimiter is "\n".
trans-unit.target: The default line delimiter is "\n".

trans-unit.source: A Hive external table is used to avoid the data file being removed from the original location if you want to run the Oozie workflow multiple times.
trans-unit.target: A Hive external table is used to avoid the data file being removed from the original location if you want to run the Oozie workflow multiple times.

trans-unit.source: The INSERT OVERWRITE statement counts the occurrences of each log-level type from the log4j Hive table, and saves the output to a blob in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: The INSERT OVERWRITE statement counts the occurrences of each log-level type from the log4j Hive table, and saves the output to a blob in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: There is a known Hive path issue.
trans-unit.target: There is a known Hive path issue.

trans-unit.source: You will run in to this issue when you submit an Oozie job.
trans-unit.target: You will run in to this issue when you submit an Oozie job.

trans-unit.source: The instructions for fixing it can be found on the TechNet Wiki: <link><linkText>HDInsight Hive error: Unable to rename[technetwiki-hive-error]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The instructions for fixing it can be found on the TechNet Wiki: <link><linkText>HDInsight Hive error: Unable to rename[technetwiki-hive-error]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To define the HiveQL script file to be called by the workflow
trans-unit.target: To define the HiveQL script file to be called by the workflow

trans-unit.source: Create a text file with the following content:
trans-unit.target: Create a text file with the following content:

trans-unit.source: There are three variables used in the script:
trans-unit.target: There are three variables used in the script:

trans-unit.source: ${hiveTableName}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveTableName}

trans-unit.source: ${hiveDataFolder}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveDataFolder}

trans-unit.source: ${hiveOutputFolder}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveOutputFolder}

trans-unit.source: The workflow definition file (workflow.xml in this tutorial) passes these values to this HiveQL script at run time.
trans-unit.target: The workflow definition file (workflow.xml in this tutorial) passes these values to this HiveQL script at run time.

trans-unit.source: Save the file as C:\Tutorials\UseOozie\useooziewf.hql by using ANSI(ASCII) encoding.
trans-unit.target: Save the file as C:\Tutorials\UseOozie\useooziewf.hql by using ANSI(ASCII) encoding.

trans-unit.source: (Use Notepad if your text editor doesn't provide this option.)
trans-unit.target: (Use Notepad if your text editor doesn't provide this option.)

trans-unit.source: This script file will be deployed to HDInsight cluster later in the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This script file will be deployed to HDInsight cluster later in the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: To define a workflow
trans-unit.target: To define a workflow

trans-unit.source: Create a text file with the following content:
trans-unit.target: Create a text file with the following content:

trans-unit.source: There are two actions defined in the workflow.
trans-unit.target: There are two actions defined in the workflow.

trans-unit.source: The start-to action is RunHiveScript.
trans-unit.target: The start-to action is RunHiveScript.

trans-unit.source: If the action runs successfully, the next action is RunSqoopExport.
trans-unit.target: If the action runs successfully, the next action is RunSqoopExport.

trans-unit.source: The RunHiveScript has several variables.
trans-unit.target: The RunHiveScript has several variables.

trans-unit.source: You will pass the values when you submit the Oozie job from your workstation by using Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: You will pass the values when you submit the Oozie job from your workstation by using Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Workflow variables
trans-unit.target: Workflow variables

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: ${jobTracker}
trans-unit.target: ${jobTracker}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the URL of the Hadoop job tracker. Use
trans-unit.target: Specifies the URL of the Hadoop job tracker. Use

trans-unit.source: jobtrackerhost:9010
trans-unit.target: jobtrackerhost:9010

trans-unit.source: in HDInsight version 3.0 and 2.1.
trans-unit.target: in HDInsight version 3.0 and 2.1.

trans-unit.source: ${nameNode}
trans-unit.target: ${nameNode}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the URL of the Hadoop name node. Use the default file system address, for example,
trans-unit.target: Specifies the URL of the Hadoop name node. Use the default file system address, for example,

trans-unit.source: wasb://<containerName>@<storageAccountName>.blob.core.windows.net
trans-unit.target: wasb://<containerName>@<storageAccountName>.blob.core.windows.net

trans-unit.source: ${queueName}
trans-unit.target: ${queueName}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the queue name that the job will be submitted to. Use the
trans-unit.target: Specifies the queue name that the job will be submitted to. Use the

trans-unit.source: default
trans-unit.target: default

trans-unit.source: Hive action variable
trans-unit.target: Hive action variable

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: ${hiveDataFolder}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveDataFolder}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the source directory for the Hive Create Table command.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the source directory for the Hive Create Table command.

trans-unit.source: ${hiveOutputFolder}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveOutputFolder}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the output folder for the INSERT OVERWRITE statement.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the output folder for the INSERT OVERWRITE statement.

trans-unit.source: ${hiveTableName}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveTableName}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the Hive table that references the log4j data files.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the Hive table that references the log4j data files.

trans-unit.source: Sqoop action variable
trans-unit.target: Sqoop action variable

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: ${sqlDatabaseConnectionString}
trans-unit.target: ${sqlDatabaseConnectionString}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Azure SQL database connection string.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Azure SQL database connection string.

trans-unit.source: ${sqlDatabaseTableName}
trans-unit.target: ${sqlDatabaseTableName}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Azure SQL database table where the data will be exported to.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Azure SQL database table where the data will be exported to.

trans-unit.source: ${hiveOutputFolder}
trans-unit.target: ${hiveOutputFolder}

trans-unit.source: Specifies the output folder for the Hive INSERT OVERWRITE statement. This is the same folder for the Sqoop export (export-dir).
trans-unit.target: Specifies the output folder for the Hive INSERT OVERWRITE statement. This is the same folder for the Sqoop export (export-dir).

trans-unit.source: For more information about Oozie workflow and using workflow actions, see <link><linkText>Apache Oozie 4.0 documentation[apache-oozie-400]</linkText><title></title></link> (for HDInsight version 3.0) or <link><linkText>Apache Oozie 3.3.2 documentation[apache-oozie-332]</linkText><title></title></link> (for HDInsight version 2.1).
trans-unit.target: For more information about Oozie workflow and using workflow actions, see <link><linkText>Apache Oozie 4.0 documentation[apache-oozie-400]</linkText><title></title></link> (for HDInsight version 3.0) or <link><linkText>Apache Oozie 3.3.2 documentation[apache-oozie-332]</linkText><title></title></link> (for HDInsight version 2.1).

trans-unit.source: Save the file as C:\Tutorials\UseOozie\workflow.xml by using ANSI (ASCII) encoding.
trans-unit.target: Save the file as C:\Tutorials\UseOozie\workflow.xml by using ANSI (ASCII) encoding.

trans-unit.source: (Use Notepad if your text editor doesn't provide this option.)
trans-unit.target: (Use Notepad if your text editor doesn't provide this option.)

trans-unit.source: Deploy the Oozie project and prepare the tutorial
trans-unit.target: Deploy the Oozie project and prepare the tutorial

trans-unit.source: You will run a Windows PowerShell script to perform the following:
trans-unit.target: You will run a Windows PowerShell script to perform the following:

trans-unit.source: Copy the HiveQL script (useoozie.hql) to Azure Storage (wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/useoozie.hql).
trans-unit.target: Copy the HiveQL script (useoozie.hql) to Azure Storage (wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/useoozie.hql).

trans-unit.source: Copy workflow.xml to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/workflow.xml.
trans-unit.target: Copy workflow.xml to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/workflow.xml.

trans-unit.source: Copy the data file (/example/data/sample.log) to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/data/sample.log.
trans-unit.target: Copy the data file (/example/data/sample.log) to wasb:///tutorials/useoozie/data/sample.log.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure SQL database table for storing Sqoop export data.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure SQL database table for storing Sqoop export data.

trans-unit.source: The table name is log4jLogCount.
trans-unit.target: The table name is log4jLogCount.

trans-unit.source: Understand HDInsight storage
trans-unit.target: Understand HDInsight storage

trans-unit.source: HDInsight uses blobs in Azure Storage for data storage.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight uses blobs in Azure Storage for data storage.

trans-unit.source: For more information see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight[hdinsight-storage]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight[hdinsight-storage]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: When you provision an HDInsight cluster, an Azure Storage account and a specific blob container from that account is designated as the default file system, like in HDFS.
trans-unit.target: When you provision an HDInsight cluster, an Azure Storage account and a specific blob container from that account is designated as the default file system, like in HDFS.

trans-unit.source: In addition to this storage account, you can add additional storage accounts from the same Azure subscription or a different Azure subscriptions during the provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: In addition to this storage account, you can add additional storage accounts from the same Azure subscription or a different Azure subscriptions during the provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: For instructions about adding additional storage accounts, see <link><linkText>Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight[hdinsight-provision]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions about adding additional storage accounts, see <link><linkText>Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight[hdinsight-provision]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To simply the Windows PowerShell script used in this tutorial, all of the files are stored in the default file storage container, which is located at /tutorials/useoozie.
trans-unit.target: To simply the Windows PowerShell script used in this tutorial, all of the files are stored in the default file storage container, which is located at /tutorials/useoozie.

trans-unit.source: By default, this container has the same name as the HDInsight cluster name.
trans-unit.target: By default, this container has the same name as the HDInsight cluster name.

trans-unit.source: The syntax is:
trans-unit.target: The syntax is:

trans-unit.source: Only the wasb:// syntax is supported in HDInsight version 3.0 clusters.
trans-unit.target: Only the wasb:// syntax is supported in HDInsight version 3.0 clusters.

trans-unit.source: The older asv:// syntax is supported in HDInsight 2.1 and 1.6 clusters, but it is not supported in HDInsight 3.0 clusters.
trans-unit.target: The older asv:// syntax is supported in HDInsight 2.1 and 1.6 clusters, but it is not supported in HDInsight 3.0 clusters.

trans-unit.source: The wasb:// path is a virtual path.
trans-unit.target: The wasb:// path is a virtual path.

trans-unit.source: For more information see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight[hdinsight-storage]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see <link><linkText>Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight[hdinsight-storage]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: A file stored in the default file system container can be accessed from HDInsight by using any of the following URIs (the following code uses workflow.xml as an example):
trans-unit.target: A file stored in the default file system container can be accessed from HDInsight by using any of the following URIs (the following code uses workflow.xml as an example):

trans-unit.source: If you want to access the file directly from the storage account, the blob name for the file is:
trans-unit.target: If you want to access the file directly from the storage account, the blob name for the file is:

trans-unit.source: Understand Hive internal and external tables
trans-unit.target: Understand Hive internal and external tables

trans-unit.source: There are a few things you need to know about Hive internal tables and external tables:
trans-unit.target: There are a few things you need to know about Hive internal tables and external tables:

trans-unit.source: The CREATE TABLE command creates an internal table, also known as a managed table.
trans-unit.target: The CREATE TABLE command creates an internal table, also known as a managed table.

trans-unit.source: The data file must be located in the default container.
trans-unit.target: The data file must be located in the default container.

trans-unit.source: The CREATE TABLE command moves the data file to the /hive/warehouse/<html></html> folder in the default container.
trans-unit.target: The CREATE TABLE command moves the data file to the /hive/warehouse/<html></html> folder in the default container.

trans-unit.source: The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE command creates an external table.
trans-unit.target: The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE command creates an external table.

trans-unit.source: The data file can be located outside the default container.
trans-unit.target: The data file can be located outside the default container.

trans-unit.source: The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE command does not move the data file.
trans-unit.target: The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE command does not move the data file.

trans-unit.source: The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE command doesn't allow any subfolders under the folder that is specified in the LOCATION clause.
trans-unit.target: The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE command doesn't allow any subfolders under the folder that is specified in the LOCATION clause.

trans-unit.source: This is why the tutorial makes a copy of the sample.log file.
trans-unit.target: This is why the tutorial makes a copy of the sample.log file.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>HDInsight: Hive Internal and External Tables Intro[cindygross-hive-tables]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>HDInsight: Hive Internal and External Tables Intro[cindygross-hive-tables]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Open the Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: Open the Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: (On the Windows 8 Start screen, type PowerShell_ISE, and then click Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: (On the Windows 8 Start screen, type PowerShell_ISE, and then click Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Start Windows PowerShell on Windows 8 and Windows[powershell-start]</linkText><title></title></link>).

trans-unit.source: In the bottom pane, run the following command to connect to your Azure subscription:
trans-unit.target: In the bottom pane, run the following command to connect to your Azure subscription:

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted to enter your Azure account credentials.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted to enter your Azure account credentials.

trans-unit.source: This method of adding a subscription connection times out, and after 12 hours, you will have to run the cmdlet again.
trans-unit.target: This method of adding a subscription connection times out, and after 12 hours, you will have to run the cmdlet again.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions and the default subscription is not the one you want to use, use the <html></html>Select-AzureSubscription<html></html> cmdlet to select the current subscription.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions and the default subscription is not the one you want to use, use the <html></html>Select-AzureSubscription<html></html> cmdlet to select the current subscription.

trans-unit.source: Run the Oozie project
trans-unit.target: Run the Oozie project

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell currently doesn't provide any cmdlets for defining Oozie jobs.
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell currently doesn't provide any cmdlets for defining Oozie jobs.

trans-unit.source: You can use the Invoke-RestMethod cmdlet to invoke Oozie web services.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Invoke-RestMethod cmdlet to invoke Oozie web services.

trans-unit.source: The Oozie web services API is a HTTP REST JSON API.
trans-unit.target: The Oozie web services API is a HTTP REST JSON API.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Oozie web services API, see <link><linkText>Apache Oozie 4.0 documentation[apache-oozie-400]</linkText><title></title></link> (for HDInsight version 3.0) or <link><linkText>Apache Oozie 3.3.2 documentation[apache-oozie-332]</linkText><title></title></link> (for HDInsight version 2.1).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Oozie web services API, see <link><linkText>Apache Oozie 4.0 documentation[apache-oozie-400]</linkText><title></title></link> (for HDInsight version 3.0) or <link><linkText>Apache Oozie 3.3.2 documentation[apache-oozie-332]</linkText><title></title></link> (for HDInsight version 2.1).
